events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection involving their vehicle and another car.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident on the basis of the vehicle collision details provided by the claimant.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to handle this case promptly to ensure smooth processing.
The claimant received official notification acknowledging the receipt of their auto accident insurance claim.
The insurer requested the accident report, photos of vehicle damages, and a copy of the repair estimate.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including accident report and photos, within the specified deadline.
An investigation began to verify the details of the car collision and to assess damage liability.
The insurance adjuster completed the investigation and confirmed the facts consistent with a rear-end collision.
A settlement offer was proposed covering full repair costs and vehicle rental while the car is being fixed.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the overall claims handling process.
The claim was formally approved following acceptance of the settlement by the insured.
The insurance payment was processed and issued to the claimantâ€™s account to cover vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed after payment confirmation and final follow-up with the claimant.
